summary: Semver 7.5.0 contains a ReDoS vulnerability (CVE-2022-25883) with CVSS score 7.5, affecting nyc-test-coverage as a transitive dependency through ts-loader. The issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was no longer part of the inventory.
userImpact: Dependency contains a ReDoS vulnerability that could cause denial of service through maliciously crafted semver ranges.
rootCause: semver library before version 7.5.2 is vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the Range function when processing untrusted user data.
proposedFix: Upgrade semver to version 7.5.2 or later (fix available since 2023-06-21).
resolutionDetails: Automatically closed by Mend after the vulnerable library was marked as ignored or removed from the Mend inventory, not through explicit remediation.
keyQuote: Versions of the package semver before 7.5.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the function new Range
